story.title: EU Pork Exports to China Are Booming on Deadly Pig Virus
story.summary: PYCERL6S9728(Bloomberg) -- Terms of Trade is a daily newsletter that untangles a world embroiled in trade wars. Sign up here. The European Union is shipping pork to China at a breakneck pace, as the Asian country grapples to contain a deadly swine virus that’s led to millions of pig deaths. Exports jumped 45% in the first seven months of the year, approaching the total for all of 2018, EU data show. But there’s a question over how long sales can keep rising -- even with increased demand,...

xmlText.p: (Bloomberg) -- Terms of Trade is a daily newsletter that untangles a world embroiled in trade wars. Sign up here.

The European Union is shipping pork to China at a breakneck pace, as the Asian country grapples to contain a deadly swine virus that’s led to millions of pig deaths. Exports jumped 45% in the first seven months of the year, approaching the total for all of 2018, EU data show. But there’s a question over how long sales can keep rising -- even with increased demand, Europe’s pork output is seen largely steady this year.
To contact the reporter on this story: Megan Durisin in London at mdurisin1@bloomberg.net
To contact the editors responsible for this story: Lynn Thomasson at lthomasson@bloomberg.net, Nicholas Larkin, Dylan Griffiths
For more articles like this, please visit us at bloomberg.com
